moves.1. e4: Since I was never any good at openings, I started with the most basic move. e4
moves.1... d5: Things started to complicate for me, never liked to study or train openings and this one was all new to me. (didn't know about Game DB, call me a Noob. :o )
moves.2. d4: I decided to try and conquer the center of the board.
moves.2... dxe4 3. Nc3: Developing pieces and aiming to get a pawn back.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Be3: Dumb move on my part. Just wasted a move, since I will move the bishop again. I would have been better of with Bc4
moves.4... e6 5. Bg5 Bb4 6. Qe2: Another dumb move, I can't explain today.
moves.6... Qxd4 7. Rd1: Only logical move at this point.
moves.7... Qe5 8. Bxf6: At this point I was hoping that he played Qxf6 so I would do Qxe4, liberating my Bishop and getting a pawn back.
moves.8... gxf6 9. g3 b6 10. f4: Another strange move, but I wasn't thinking proper.
moves.10... Bxc3+ 11. bxc3 Qxc3+ 12. Kf2: At this point, running away was best, since I couldn't afford to exchange more pieces, given my pawn disadvantage.
moves.12... f5: I  believe he would be better off with Rg8. It would apply extra pressure on my already difficult position.
moves.13. Nh3 Ba6 14. Qd2: I had no choice at this point, I had to deliver my queen to the exchange.
moves.16. Ng5: Time to budge that Black Queen away.
moves.16... Qa3 17. Bxa6: Clearing some of the pressure on my king.
moves.17... Nxa6 18. c3: I stop him from doing Nb4 while protecting my a2 pawn
moves.19... Nd3 20. Rhf1: No idea why I played this, but I was running low on ideas.
moves.20... Rad8 21. Qe2: Taking my queen out of harms way.
moves.21... Kg7 22. Qh5: Finally a chance to put a bit of pressure of my own.
moves.22... Qxc3 23. Nxe4: This seems like a  dumb move, but Qxh7 would only help him develop his rook on the h column. I sacrifice my Knigh, but...
moves.23... fxe4 24. f5: Now I'm getting some where. I think...
moves.24... Nf4+: He decides to give me my Knight back, can't imagine why.
Check Mate. Couldn't believe I had won.
